Sorry, couldn't follow the logic: if have LatestFinalizedBlock why don't we have EarliestAvailableBlock?

The method getLatestFinalizedBlock name isn't very clear - should probably be getLatestFinalizedBlockOrSummary.  Basically we always have a latestFinalizedState and latest finalized checkpoint available in the hot db.  But if we start up from a state alone, we won't have the latest finalized block.  So, getLatestFinalizedBlock tries to look up the latest finalized block by root, and if that fails it returns the latest block header from the latest finalized state.
I'll try to clean this up - should probably add a method that directly returns the block header from the latest finalized state.
Maybe move thenAccept() before exceptionally() and remove newValue != null condition? Would look a bit more clear imho.
It would read more clearly, but if the thenAccept method throws for some reason, I wouldn't want to assume the error is coming from the fetch task.
